thread.title: Paul Ryan Re-elected As Speaker Of The House
thread.title_full: Paul Ryan Re-elected As Speaker Of The House

author: Andrew Kerr
title: Paul Ryan Re-elected As Speaker Of The House
text:
Paul Ryan Re-elected As Speaker Of The House "This is a real opportunity ..." by Andrew Kerr January 3, 2017 at 1:16pm 
House Republicans voted almost unanimously on Tuesday to reelect Paul Ryan as speaker of the House. 
The lone republican dissenter, Rep. Thomas Massie , R-Ky., voted for Daniel Webster, R-Fla. 
House Republicans’ overwhelming support of Ryan is a milestone for a House GOP that has long been considered to be deeply divided. Advertisement - story continues below 
Ryan won the full support of the conservative House Freedom Caucus, a group of representatives that flirted with the idea of ousting Ryan earlier this year. 
Ryan’s political future has changed dramatically following Donald Trump’s victory in November. 
When Ryan took over as House Speaker 14 months ago, he was considered to be the future of the Republican party. Advertisement - story continues below 
Now he is seen to be more of a second-hand man to President-elect Trump. 
“Paul is going from the guy everyone looked to to rebuild the party to being a helping hand to the president,” retiring Rep. Lynn Westmoreland, R-Ga., told Politico. 
Westmoreland continued, saying that lawmakers typically fall behind the president when their party controls the White House. House Republicans won’t “have as much freedom” as they did when they “were working against a Democratic president.” 
“When your party elects a president, that president becomes the head of your party — period,” another House Republican told Politico. “Paul understands that.” Advertisement - story continues below
